intro: Silene haradjianii, commonly known as the Haradjian's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of California and Nevada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene haradjianii is considered a vulnerable species.
